result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J Roffers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 160 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Request to Issue Civil Judgment for Court Costs. ew
DOC Motion for Civil Judgment.  Returned due to lack of Agent signature.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Statements made as to sentencing.  

As to Count 1 as Amenced:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 160 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 MONTHS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for  the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

filed:  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 33.

Court orders a $500.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 7/30/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms
(8/25/2014 court date in br 20 is cancelled)
Br. 06 clerk notified of July date, however, case must be set out 30 days. Next court date is 8/25/14 at 8:30 a.m. for status before Branch 20 to allow placement to proceed.

Parties advise the Court that due to the amendment of the charge, defendant would now be eligible for drug treatment court.  Court allowed for transfer of same to Branch 06.  Attorney Carpenter advised the Court that the next court date set in Branch 06 is 7/30/14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Lucas J Roffers in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Lucas J Roffers in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:
Attempt Theft from Person or Corpse, an attempt to Commit a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), and 939.32.
